feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 17 at 9:02PM AKDT until September 18 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta coast. Highest water levels will be from Kipnuk north to Newtok. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise up to 4 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...Through 4 AM AKDT Sunday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall will continue to fall over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post- tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Expect three-day rainfall totals around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in the peaks of the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hancock, southern Van Buren, southwestern Lee, eastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 230 AM CDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 1:48AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AFFECTING TONIGHT... Areas of locally dense fog will affect portions of northern Wisconsin. A report of dense fog with low visibility was received late this evening for the area between Drummond and Grand View. Expect areas of dense fog through the night with visibilities of 1/2 to 1/4 mile. If traveling tonight, reduce your speed and use
